Posts.Title: Story of a cancer doctor losing his wife to BC angiephnx stagefree

Posts.Content: May 8, 2014 02:20PM lurkingnomore wrote: Thanks everyone for the warm welcome!  LSpelling, glad you decided to join me.  And, yes, you will feel better! I was limping around for months but my MO and I thought I was just getting older and was doing this weight training program called body pump.  My MO didn't think my aches and pains were cancer related, as I had the most aggressive treatment when I was first diagnosed.  Lumpectomy, AC and T, radiation and hormonals.   When we finally did the scan I lit up like a Christmas tree.  Part of my pelvis area was chewed away.  I was to start treatment soon with radiation but before that started I fell slightly and broke my pelvis.  I was out of commission for quite some time. So, LSpelling, I know how you feel!  However,  about a year and a half later, I feel pretty normal most of the time.  But, you have to be patient, as the radiation does help a lot, but it takes time. Thanks again everyone! Lisa
Posts.Title: Moving from lurking to being a true member lurkingnomore chris1959

Posts.Content: May 8, 2014 06:29PM lurkingnomore wrote: Lynette, It also took me some time to recover from the radiation.  That is probably why you are so fatigued and achy.    The radiation went through my abdominal area and I was sick, sick, sick!  Only good thing about it was that I lost about 20 pounds as food made me feel nauseous.  Unfortunately that didn't last long, as I'm forbidden to do my Body Pump or Zumba classes because of the risk with spine mets.  Now I'm stuck with the boring elliptical. :( Lisa
Posts.Title: Moving from lurking to being a true member lurkingnomore chris1959

Posts.Content: May 8, 2014 08:13PM lurkingnomore wrote: Thanks!  And, no he doesn't use TMs and CTCs.  He thinks they cause undo stress and aren't reliable.  But maybe if he did I could have caught my bone Mets in time before I had to go through the pain of the fracture.  Getting on and off that radiation table was torture!!

Posts.Content: May 11, 2014 06:27PM lurkingnomore wrote: First of all, Happy Mother's Day to all!! Thanks for the additional feedback Ebru , Raro and Caryn.  I will be honest with my MO and let him know my concerns.  He hasn't even really said that I have mets in the other places than my bones. And, if he tries to pussy foot around again I will seek another MO.  I appreciate the referral, Caryn.  I really don't want to start all over at a different place. Ebru, my husband I are are thinking of taking a trip (hopefully!!) this fall while I can.  We were thinking of going to Italy, but I have followed your great pictures for some time.  I think that Turkey would be different and much more interesting.  What do you think?  I have a hard time walking too far, but can usually go a mile or so without my hip hurting.   All the best to all~ Lisa
